DOC.brief_summary: This single centre , non-randomised , baseline control , prospective pilot clinical trial undertaken Rotherham General Hospital , Rotherham , UK . The study examine safety performance new urinary catheter , Alternative Catheter System ( ACS ) ( Alternative Urological Catheter Systems Ltd ( AUCS ) , Bristol , UK ) develop reduce morbidity long-term catheterisation acknowledge deficiency conventional Foley urinary catheter .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male female , least 18 year age . 2 . Patient authorise representative must able comprehend sign Informed Consent Form prior enrolment study . 3 . Capable use catheter valve empty bladder able communicate experience system OR carer able fulfil task . 4 . Fitted suprapubic catheter ( least 2 week post insertion ) . 5 . Ability attend outpatient clinic regular interval throughout study able participate maximum 8 week . 6 . History catheter blockage , bypass episode pyrexia bacteraemia last 2 month . 1 . < 18 year age . 2 . Pregnant lactating female . 3 . History catheter associate septicaemia past month . 4 . Evidence current systemic infection . 5 . Bladder pathology tumour stone > 0.5cm determined cystoscopy . 6 . Flaccid bladder . 7 . BMI > 35 . 8 . Current participation another device drug study . 9 . Unwilling unable provide inform consent .
